history.content: It is unlikely that you would be approved for a 6th semester, but you would need to speak to your ESS adviser (assuming you are EECS).

children.subject: I think if you take the fall semester off and work full time, it will not count against your semester count, and you can return for your 5th semester in the spring (but you should talk to your advisor)

history.content:
I'm a transfer student and my expected graduation is December 2017, that will be my 5th semester.

However there's a potential Fall 2017 internship/co-of offer lined up for me, which can only be offered if I'm returning for another semester.

I'm thinking about being a student part time in Fall 2017 or perhaps even taking a semester off.

Is it possible to push my graduation to May 2018?

Are there any disadvantages to doing this in academia?

Who can I speak to about this?
history.subject: Is it possible to do a 6th semester as a transfer student?
